title: ExcelMIN Function

metadata.description: Learn about ExcelMIN Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Excel
MIN Function

MIN Function
The
MIN
function is a premade function in Excel
content_sections.content: , which finds the lowest number in a range.

content_sections.title: It is typed
content_sections.content:
=MIN
The function ignores cells with text. It will only work for cells with numbers.
Note:
There is another function called
MAX
, which finds the highest value in a range, the opposite of
MIN
.

content_sections.title: Type
content_sections.content:
=MIN
Double click the
MIN
command
Select a range (
D2:D21
)
Hit enter
Let's have a look at an example!
Find the Pokemon which has the lowest total stats in the range
D2:D21
:
Name	Type 1	Type 2	Total stats		
    Mankey	Fighting		305		
    Poliwrath	Water	Fighting	510		
    Victreebel	Grass	Poison	490		
    Tentacool	Water	Poison	335		
    Magneton	Electric	Steel	465		MIN
    Dewgong	Water	Ice	475		
    Cloyster	Water	Ice	525		
    Onix	Rock	Ground	385		
    Dragonair	Dragon		420		
    Pidgeotto	Normal	Flying	349		
    Rattata	Normal		253		
    Beedrill	Bug	Poison	395		
    Doduo	Normal	Flying	310		
    Kingler	Water		475		
    Nidoqueen	Poison	Ground	505		
    Hitmonchan	Fighting		455		
    Charmeleon	Fire		405		
    Arbok	Poison		438		
    Gastly	Ghost	Poison	310		
    Magikarp	Water		200
Copy Values
Look at that!
The function has successfully found the lowest value,
200
. Magikarp has the lowest Total stats of the Pokemons in the range
D2:D21
.
Let's add text to a cell in the range
D2:21
to see what happens. Type Kadabra to
D21
.
Right on!
The function ignores the text typed in the range.
253
is returned as the new lowest value, as the old one was replaced with text. Rattata is now the Pokemon with the lowest Total stats in the range
D2:D21
.

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers ExcelMIN Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use ExcelMIN Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of ExcelMIN Function and how to apply it in your projects.
